channel.title: BBC News - Home
channel.description: The latest stories from the Home section of the BBC News web site.
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Berezovsky house given all-clear
item.description: The Berkshire home of dead Russian tycoon Boris Berezovsky is given the all-clear after it was searched for chemical, biological and nuclear material.

item.title: Power problems remain in severe cold
item.description: Thousands of homes around the UK remain without electricity after severe weather disrupted supplies.

item.title: Vettel ignores team orders to win
item.description: Red Bull's Sebastian Vettel ignores team orders in the Malaysian GP to win a battle with team-mate Mark Webber.

item.title: Syrian opposition leader resigns
item.description: The leader of the opposition Syrian National Council, Ahmed Moaz al-Khatib, has resigned, he says in a statement.

item.title: Cypriot president in Brussels talks
item.description: Cypriot President Nicos Anastasiades begins a series of emergency meetings in Brussels in a last-ditch effort to finalise a bailout and avoid bankruptcy.

item.title: Musharraf returns to Pakistan
item.description: Former Pakistani President Pervez Musharraf returns to Pakistan, ending his self-imposed four-year exile and defying death threats.

item.title: PM wants residency test for housing
item.description: Immigrant families will be kept off council house waiting lists in England for at least two years, under plans set to be announced by the prime minister.

item.title: Crash leaves car embedded in house
item.description: A man is seriously ill in hospital after an Audi TT crashed and ended up embedded in a house.

item.title: Laura Ashley accused over suppliers
item.description: Retailer Laura Ashley denies squeezing its suppliers and says it is looking to provide products at the "right price".

item.title: Agra hotel jump woman recalls ordeal
item.description: A British woman tells the BBC that she shouted for help for more than an hour before jumping from a hotel balcony in India fearing a sexual assault.

item.title: CAR President Bozize flees capital
item.description: Looting is reported in the capital of the Central African Republic after President Francois Bozize flees and rebels take control of the city.

item.title: Rare Beatles photos fetch £30,000
item.description: Pictures of The Beatles' historic 1965 Shea Stadium concert, taken by an amateur photographer who bluffed his way backstage, sell for £30,000.

item.title: Britpop rivals unite for charity
item.description: Former Britpop rivals Noel Gallagher and Damon Albarn bury the hatchet to perform together at a concert for the Teenage Cancer Trust.

item.title: Fifa could rule on NI v Russia date
item.description: Northern Ireland boss Michael O'Neill wants Russia game in May but Fifa might have to rule on new date.

item.title: Scots curlers are world champions
item.description: Scotland win in the final of the World Women's Curling Championship in Riga, narrowly beating Sweden 6-5.

item.title: England face huge task to save Test
item.description: England face a massive task to avoid a series defeat after New Zealand open a 274-run lead on a thrilling third day in Auckland.

item.title: Keane doubt for Republic qualifier
item.description: Republic of Ireland skipper Robbie Keane is an injury concern for Tuesday's World Cup qualifier with Austria.

item.title: Brits clinch four rowing golds
item.description: Britain's new-look rowing teams produce sparkling displays to clinch four golds at the Rowing World Cup in Sydney.

item.title: Customers safe, say Cyprus UK banks
item.description: Cypriot banks operating in the UK have insisted their customers will not be affected by any bailout deal.

item.title: Nestle recalls Kit Kat Chunky bars
item.description: Nestle is recalling some of its varieties of Chunky Kit Kat after seven people found pieces of plastic in bars.

item.title: UKIP 'only Westminster alternative'
item.description: Voters are turning to the UK Independence Party as it is the only party with alternative policies, its leader Nigel Farage has told activists.

item.title: Sturgeon outlines independence case
item.description: Deputy SNP leader Nicola Sturgeon will insist Scotland can afford to be independent, as she outlines the economic case for going it alone.

item.title: 'Visionary' leadership needed on TB
item.description: Plans to tackle tuberculosis are failing and a new visionary approach is needed, according to an international group of doctors and scientists.

item.title: Warning over 'struggling GP system'
item.description: Patients in England do not feel safe relying on GP out-of-hours care and are struggling to get access to doctors during normal hours, a leading patient group is warning.

item.title: Disruptive pupil behaviour 'on rise'
item.description: A teachers' union says the number of pupils in the UK with behavioural and mental health problems is on the rise.

item.title: Boys 'suffer from low body image'
item.description: Boys increasingly have low self-esteem about their body image, teachers warn.

item.title: Blizzard reveals trading card game
item.description: Blizzard has taken the wraps off the new title it has been developing - a collectable card game based around its Warcraft world.

item.title: Microsoft details data snoopers
item.description: US law enforcement agencies top the list of police forces requesting detailed data about Microsoft users, a report shows.

item.title: Dinosaur-killing rock 'was a comet'
item.description: The space rock that hit Earth 65 million years ago, widely implicated in killing off the dinosaurs, was probably a fast-moving comet, researchers say.

item.title: Advert turns air into drinking water
item.description: A billboard that draws humidity from the air in a rain-starved part of Peru delivers 96 litres of water a day - and has become a local attraction.

item.title: Schwarzenegger mentor Weider dies
item.description: Bodybuilding guru Joe Weider, the man who launched Arnold Schwarzenegger's Hollywood career, dies aged 93.

item.title: My Chemical Romance announce split
item.description: The US rock group announce their break-up after 12 years together.

item.title: Why does Game of Thrones inspire such devotion among fans?
item.description: US TV show Game of Thrones has a cult following. But the behaviour of fans is almost as intriguing as the action on screen.

item.title: Quiz of the week's news
item.description: The Magazine's weekly quiz of the news, 7 days 7 questions.

item.title: Snow-hit villages 'low on food'
item.description: Lancashire villages in the area where a man's body was found in large drifts of snow are "running out of food" after being cut off, police say.

item.title: Collapse death house 'too unsafe'
item.description: A house where a woman died when the building collapsed in Looe, Cornwall is to be demolished, a councillor is told.

item.title: Islanders' fear over power supplies
item.description: Residents on the west coast island of Arran fear it could be six more days before their electricity - cut off in snowy blizzards - is fully restored.

item.title: Salmond wants TV debate with Cameron
item.description: First Minister Alex Salmond says he is prepared to go head-to-head with Prime Minister David Cameron in a TV debate on Scottish independence.

item.title: Thousands still without power in NI
item.description: Emergency repair crews are trying to restore electricity to 10,000 customers and the RAF sends a rescue helicopter from Wales to Northern Ireland.

item.title: Bomb found in car in Fermanagh
item.description: A bomb found in a car in County Fermanagh was probably destined for a police station in the area, the Police Service of Northern Ireland say.

item.title: Power cuts continue after heavy snow
item.description: Fewer than 400 homes in north east Wales remain without electricity as snow disruption begins to ease.

item.title: Miliband praise for Welsh government
item.description: Ed Miliband says Carwyn Jones is showing the difference a Labour government can make during the party's Welsh spring conference in Llandudno.

item.title: Islamist rebels attack Mali town
item.description: Islamist rebels attack Gao in northern Mali, officials say, and are only repelled after a firefight lasting several hours.

item.title: Deadly attacks on Nigeria town
item.description: At least 25 people are killed as gunmen attack a prison, a police station, a bank and a bar in an eastern Nigerian town, police say.

item.title: China leader Xi hails Russia ties
item.description: Chinese leader Xi Jinping says friendship with Russia guarantees a global strategic balance, on the second day of his trip to Moscow.

item.title: Sydney dims down for Earth Hour
item.description: Australia's biggest city, Sydney, switches off its lights as the annual Earth Day climate change protest gets under way across the globe.

item.title: New Pope to visit Brazil in July
item.description: Pope Francis, the Catholic Church's first Latin American leader, announces in his Palm Sunday homily he will visit Brazil in July for a youth festival.

item.title: Gunmen free prisoners at Greek jail
item.description: Eleven inmates are missing and two guards injured after gunmen attack a Greek prison, less than a week after a hostage siege at a different jail.

item.title: Mexico finds ancient playing fields
item.description: Three pre-Columbian pelota courts at least 1,000 years old are uncovered at the Tajin archaeological site in Mexico by experts using laser scanners.

item.title: Charges over Brazil nightclub fire
item.description: Police in Brazil say 16 people will be prosecuted over a nightclub fire in the town of Santa Maria in January, which left 241 people dead.

item.title: Kerry presses Iraq on Iran flights
item.description: US Secretary of State John Kerry says it is problematic that Iranian planes with arms for Syria are flying over Iraq, in an unannounced visit to Baghdad.

item.title: Israeli apology for flotilla deaths
item.description: Israel apologises to Turkey for any errors that resulted in the deaths of nine activists during the raid on a flotilla bound for Gaza in 2010.

item.title: Possible suspect in Colorado killing
item.description: Officials are investigating if a gunman who died after a shootout with Texas police on Thursday is linked to a Colorado prison chief's murder.

item.title: Obama visits ancient ruins of Petra
item.description: US President Barack Obama ends his visit to the Middle East with a trip to the famous ancient ruins of Petra in Jordan.

item.title: Week in pictures: 16-22 March 2013
item.description: A selection of the best photos from the news

item.title: Day in pictures: 22 March 2013
item.description: Twenty-four hours of news photos: 22 March

item.title: In pictures: Lives in limbo on India-Bangladesh border
item.description: Alakananda Nag explores the India-Bangladesh border

item.title: In Pictures: Ecology photo contest's winners
item.description: A stunning display of nature's diversity

item.title: In pictures: Obama in Israel
item.description: Obama's first visit to Israel as president

item.title: Day in pictures: 21 March 2013
item.description: Twenty-four hours of news: 21 March 2013

item.title: In pictures: Car bombs bring chaos to Baghdad
item.description: Aftermath of a series of explosions in Iraqi capital

item.title: In pictures: Sony World Photography Awards
item.description: Winners of the Open, 3D and Youth categories

item.title: VIDEO: House of Commons
item.description: George Osborne cuts growth forecasts, corporation tax, and tax on beer.

item.title: VIDEO: Power 'nowhere near' being restored
item.description: Thousands of homes could remain without power for days as suppliers struggle to reconnect people cut off by heavy snow and high winds.

item.title: VIDEO: Mayor Johnson grilled over integrity
item.description: The Mayor of London Boris Johnson has defended his integrity following revelations made in an upcoming BBC Two Documentary.

item.title: VIDEO: Albarn and Gallagher on stage
item.description: Damon Albarn and Noel Gallagher have put two decades of bitter Britpop rivalry behind them by performing together for the first time.

item.title: VIDEO: Webber & Vettel do battle in Malaysia
item.description: Red Bull's Sebastian Vettel ignores team orders as he battles with team-mate Mark Webber for the lead of the Malaysian Grand Prix.

item.title: VIDEO: Peng Liyuan: China's stylish first lady
item.description: China's new first lady has become a media and internet sensation in her homeland as she accompanies her husband, President Xi Jinping, on a visit to Russia.

item.title: VIDEO: Musharraf arrives back in Pakistan
item.description: The former Pakistani President Pervez Musharraf has arrived back in the country after four years of self-imposed exile.

item.title: VIDEO: Deadly tornado strikes Bangladesh
item.description: At least 21 people have been killed and 200 hundred injured after a powerful tornado tore through eastern Bangladesh on Friday, disaster officials say.

item.title: VIDEO: Hollywood lived happily ever after
item.description: Jack the Giant Slayer is just one of a string of adventures stemming from childhood bedtime stories being produced in Hollywood at the moment.

item.title: The riches beneath Mongolia's Turquoise Hill
item.description: The nomad who found a giant mineral reserve in the desert

item.title: Chess and 18th Century artificial intelligence
item.description: How 18th Century chess robot was more than an elaborate hoax

item.title: Delivery dads: Readers share their stories
item.description: Why readers did - or didn't - see the birth of their babies

item.title: Painful search for Argentina's disappeared
item.description: The families still looking for Argentina's 'disappeared'

item.title: In pictures: Earth Hour around the world
item.description: Lights go out for Earth Hour to raise awareness of climate change

item.title: A boy named North West
item.description: Does your name shape who you become?

item.title: Obama's Long Game in the Middle East
item.description: Mark Mardell on Obama's Middle East ambition

item.title: Is Cyprus small enough?
item.description: How small is too small to matter, asks Stephanie Flanders
